plain_text:
September 27, 1993
[NOT FOR PUBLICATION]

UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS
FOR THE FIRST CIRCUIT


No. 93-1246 

ROBERT A. GAUDREAULT,

Plaintiff, Appellant,

v.

UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, DEPARTMENT OF VETERAN AFFAIRS,

Defendant, Appellee.



APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT

FOR THE DISTRICT OF MASSACHUSETTS

[Hon. A. David Mazzone, U.S. District Judge]
           



Before

Breyer, Chief Judge,

Selya and Boudin, Circuit Judges.
     



Robert A. Gaudreault on brief pro se.

A.  John  Pappalardo,  United  States  Attorney,  and  William  L.
                         
Parker, Assistant United States Attorney, on brief for appellee.






Per Curiam.   We have reviewed  the parties' briefs


and  the record  on appeal.   We  affirm essentially  for the

reasons stated in the district court's memorandum and  order,

dated February 19, 1993.

Affirmed.  See 1st Cir. Loc. R. 27.1.

7 F.3d 218

NOTICE: First Circuit Local Rule 36.2(b)6 states unpublished opinions may be cited only in related cases.
Robert A. GAUDREAULT, Plaintiff, Appellant,
v.
UNITED STATES of America, Department of Veteran Affairs,
Defendant, Appellee.

No. 93-1246.

United States Court of Appeals,
First Circuit.

September 27, 1993

APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF MASSACHUSETTS

Robert A. Gaudreault on brief pro se.

A. John Pappalardo, United States Attorney, and William L. Parker, Assistant United States Attorney, on brief for appellee.

D.Mass.

AFFIRMED.

Before Breyer, Chief Judge, Selya and Boudin, Circuit Judges.

Per Curiam.

1

We have reviewed the parties' briefs and the record on appeal. We affirm essentially for the reasons stated in the district court's memorandum and order, dated February 19, 1993.

2

Affirmed. See 1st Cir. Loc. R. 27.1.
